summary: Fjord and Beau: We got here so early that we thought had time to dick around then we went to that wizard’s tower, then we lost...
body:
Fjord and Beau: We got here so early that we thought had time to dick around then we went to that wizard’s tower, then we lost track of time and suddenly we were late.

Caleb: That is the dumbest thing I’ve ever heard. That is not a real thing.

Fjord and Beau: Yes it is. It’s the over-dick-around thing. We over-dicked it.

reblog.comment:

blog.name: sandssavvy
blog.title: Where fandoms collide
blog.description:
I am a giant geek so there will be a lot of fandom posts. However I will also reblog a lot of current events, social justice, etc. I also have some old rp blogs. I am white, dyadic, genderfluid (she or they pronouns), and asexual biromantic. I intend for this blog to be queer positive, trans positive, anti-racism, and intersectionally feminist.

Please let me know if you need any specific trigger warnings if you follow me. I try to trigger warn for any content about rape with "rape culture", "rape", or "tw:rape" also I tag "gifs" or "Gif set" for anyone with epilepsy

My Archive of Our Own fanfic page.

My youtube account

It is mainly full of Critical Role compilation vids and cosplay vids.

and my Ko-fi is here.

In case you would like to support me.

Tumblr posts of my vids are here

summary: This videographer making a Dragon Con CMV caught a really cute moment of me handing a flower crown to a little princess during...
body:
This videographer making a Dragon Con CMV caught a really cute moment of me handing a flower crown to a little princess during the parade. I’m so happy they caught it. The whole video just makes me miss Dragon Con so much, there’s no con like it. The energy and welcoming and positive spirit is on another level.

Clip of me is around 2:25

Fun fact: the first two kids that got flower crowns (I mostly handed them to little kids in princess dresses that didn’t already have crowns on that I could spot in the crowd along the parade route) recoiled in complete horror as a red, pupil-less-eyed, sword wielding tiefling with a big stupid grin exposing my rather convincing looking fangs came sauntering over to them. This is why I bring them flower crowns, haha, to show them that even the people dressed as monsters are just there to have a good time like everyone else, because I know the horror genre cosplayers give some of them a bit of a spook.

Fun fact: the first two kids that got flower crowns (I mostly handed them to little kids in princess dresses that didn’t already have crowns on that I could spot in the crowd along the parade route) recoiled in complete horror as a red, pupil-less-eyed, sword wielding tiefling with a big stupid grin exposing my rather convincing looking fangs came sauntering over to them. This is why I bring them flower crowns, haha, to show them that even the people dressed as monsters are just there to have a good time like everyone else, because I know the horror genre cosplayers give some of them a bit of a spook.

The whole video just makes me miss Dragon Con so much, there’s no con like it. The energy and welcoming and positive spirit is on another level.

Clip of me is around 2:25

Fun fact: the first two kids that got flower crowns (I mostly handed them to little kids in princess dresses that didn’t already have crowns on that I could spot in the crowd along the parade route) recoiled in complete horror as a red, pupil-less-eyed, sword wielding tiefling with a big stupid grin exposing my rather convincing looking fangs came sauntering over to them. This is why I bring them flower crowns, haha, to show them that even the people dressed as monsters are just there to have a good time like everyone else, because I know the horror genre cosplayers give some of them a bit of a spook.
trail.content:
This videographer making a Dragon Con CMV caught a really cute moment of me handing a flower crown to a little princess during the parade. I’m so happy they caught it. The whole video just makes me miss Dragon Con so much, there’s no con like it. The energy and welcoming and positive spirit is on another level.

Clip of me is around 2:25

Fun fact: the first two kids that got flower crowns (I mostly handed them to little kids in princess dresses that didn’t already have crowns on that I could spot in the crowd along the parade route) recoiled in complete horror as a red, pupil-less-eyed, sword wielding tiefling with a big stupid grin exposing my rather convincing looking fangs came sauntering over to them. This is why I bring them flower crowns, haha, to show them that even the people dressed as monsters are just there to have a good time like everyone else, because I know the horror genre cosplayers give some of them a bit of a spook.

summary: Jester reunites with her mother and has a surprising revelation about her father. Watch the cast's faces closely to witness when...
caption:
Jester reunites with her mother and has a surprising revelation about her father. Watch the cast’s faces closely to witness when they realize who Jester’s dad is.
Also, we witness the most high stakes game of Pictionary, ever.
Meanwhile, Matt does a great job playing The Ruby of The Sea and blowing all of our minds.

Jester casts Sending to verify her dad’s identity.

Footage from Critical Role Campaign 2 Episode 33: “The Ruby and the Sapphire”

Subscribe if you want to see more of my Critical Role compilation vids as they are released.

summary:
Iron Shephard: Oh please, you wouldn't hurt a fly!
Jester: You're right! Because a fly is an innocent creature that never...
body:
Iron Shephard: Oh please, you wouldn't hurt a fly!
Jester: You're right! Because a fly is an innocent creature that never knowingly did anything to anybody. You, however, I would maim.

summary: Critical Role ep 110
body:
Critical Role ep 110

Matt skipped Keyleth during combat, and he apologizes profusely, saying he feels really bad. And the way Marisha said “that’s okay, you’re so cute!” Made me die a little bit inside. They’re really adorable.

tags: sneak peak of something i might finish
summary: "Benicio! Stop smelling Tary!"  Beni straightened, staring at Lawrence from where he stood, closer to Taryon then Lawrence...
body:
“Benicio! Stop smelling Tary!" 

Beni straightened, staring at Lawrence from where he stood, closer to Taryon then Lawrence preferred, "Bear bakery, dude." 

Lawrance frowned, seeing the bewildered expression on Tary’s face, "What?" 

"He smells like a bakery! One with bears! I was curious about his smell, it’s fine bro." 

Lawrence watched Tary look between them as they talked, expression blessedly curious instead of suspicious. It didn’t make it better that Beni was fucking around before he had a chance to explain the situation, but it was a potentially good sign.
